newsitem.title: UK: Rexam sells four more units.
newsitem.headline: Rexam sells four more units.

text.p: Rexam Plc said on Monday it is to sell a further four of its subsidiaries including the 18.9 million stg cash sale of its U.S. and Canada containers business to Silgan Plastics, a unit of Silgan Holdings Inc.
Rexam also said it will sell Tactus International, to Cookson Group Plc for 3.2 million stg in cash and printing company Benham & Co for 2.25 million stg in cash to Goodhead Group Plc.
Rexam said the combined turnover and operating profit of the businesses in 1996 was 37.8 million stg and 1.5 million stg respectively and the net assets at the end of last year were 23.5 million stg.
Since announcing a disposal programme in December of last year, Rexam has now sold seven units for a total of about 64 million stg.
Chief executive Rolf Borjesson said he expects the programme to be complete by June next year.
